cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles west-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and expected to turn north toward a western Florida Panhandle landfall, then track inland across AL/GA
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle near Panama City, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the AL/FL border to Navarre (western Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line; Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend and western Panhandle, with effects extending eastward along the west-central Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible in squalls; sustained TS winds unlikely (â‰¤7% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1-2 ft surge possible around Tampa Bay and Port Manatee at high tide, but not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-3 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts; bands begin Sunday afternoon and taper Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and an isolated tornado threat in outer rain bands.
